meanings.definition: A plant of the genus Alyssum, especially the yellow alyssum (Alyssum alyssoides).
meanings.sent1: The madwort in the garden has bright yellow flowers.
meanings.sent2: I planted some madwort in my backyard for its lovely color.
meanings.sent3: The bees buzz happily around the madwort, enjoying its nectar.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as radiant as a field of blooming madwort.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the madwort filled the air with sweetness.

meanings.definition: A plant of the genus Asperugo, especially the European woodruff (Asperugo procumbens).
meanings.sent1: The madwort near the forest edge adds a touch of greenery.
meanings.sent2: The herbalist collected some madwort for medicinal purposes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel hid its acorn stash under the madwort leaves.
meanings.sent4: The madwort carpeted the ground like a soft, green blanket.
meanings.sent5: The delicate beauty of the madwort enchanted all who passed by.
